item.title: How to print all sessions currently set in PHP?
item.description:
How to print all sessions currently set in PHP?

Without having to call each session by name, is there a way to display the contents of all sessions currently set?

item.title: Get URL query string
item.description:
Get URL query string

This code and notation is not mine. Evan K solves a multi value same name query with a custom function ;) is taken from : http://php.net/manual/en/function.parse-str.php#76792 Credits go to Evan K. It bears mentioning that the parse_str builtin does NOT process a query string in the CGI standard way, when it comes to duplicate fields.

item.title: FAQ - Frequently Asked Questions - phpMyAdmin 4.7.0-dev documentation
item.description:
FAQ - Frequently Asked Questions - phpMyAdmin 4.7.0-dev documentation

Try to set the directive to in your config.inc.php file and the zlib.output_compression directive to in your php configuration file. You should first try the latest versions of Apache (and possibly MySQL). If your server keeps crashing, please ask for help in the various Apache support groups.

item.title: mmsnmptrapd message modification module
item.description:
mmsnmptrapd message modification module

back to rsyslog module overview Module Name: imtcp Author: Rainer Gerhards (custom-created) Multi-Ruleset Support: since 5.8.1 Description: This module uses a specific configuration of snmptrapd's tag values to obtain information of the original source system and the severity present inside the original SNMP trap. It then replaces these fields inside the syslog message.

item.title: Writing syslog Data to MySQL
item.description:
Writing syslog Data to MySQL

Written by Rainer Gerhards (2008-02-28) In this paper, I describe how to write syslog messages to aMySQL database. Having syslog messages in a database is often handy, especially when you intend to set up a front-end for viewing them. This paper describes an approach withrsyslogd, an alternative enhanced syslog daemon natively supporting MySQL.

item.title: syslog-protocol support in rsyslog
item.description:
syslog-protocol support in rsyslog

Rsyslog provides a trial implementation of the proposed syslog-protocol standard. The intention of this implementation is to find out what inside syslog-protocol is causing problems during implementation. As syslog-protocol is a standard under development, its support in rsyslog is highly volatile. It may change from release to release.

item.title: 7 Version Control Systems Reviewed - Smashing Magazine
item.description:
7 Version Control Systems Reviewed - Smashing Magazine

If you've ever collaborated with other people on a project, you know the frustration of constantly swapping files. Some do it by email, some through file upload services and some by other methods. It's a pain in the neck, and every designer and developer knows it.
